case_vignette:
A 40-year-old woman comes to the physician for right lower abdominal pain for 6 months. She has multiple non-bloody, watery bowel movements daily and experiences abdominal cramping. Sometimes, she feels sudden palpitations, is short of breath, and her face becomes red. She has lost 7 kg over the past 3 months. She went on a 3-week hiking trip to Cambodia 6 months ago. She has smoked a pack of cigarettes daily for 15 years. Her temperature is 37˚C (98.6°F), her pulse is 72/min and her blood pressure is 125/70 mm Hg. On physical examination, tiny blood vessels are noted on her face and arms. Lung auscultation shows bilateral wheezing. The abdomen is soft and nondistended. There is localized tenderness to the right lower quadrant, but no rebound tenderness or guarding. Laboratory studies show:
Leukocyte count 4,600 /mm3
Segmented neutrophils 61 %
Eosinophils 2 %
Platelet count 254,000 /mm3
Hemoglobin 13.1 g/dL
Serum
Aspartate aminotransferase (AST) 110 IU/L
Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) 128 IU/L
C-reactive protein 8 mg/dL (N = 0–10)
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?"

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Gastrointestinal System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I've been experiencing right lower abdominal pain for 6 months, have multiple non-bloody, watery bowel movements daily, and sometimes I get sudden bouts of palpitations, shortness of breath, and a red face. Additionally, I've lost some weight recently.
Have you noticed any pattern or specific foods that seem to trigger your symptoms?
No, I haven't noticed any specific foods or patterns that trigger my symptoms.
Do you have any other medical conditions or are you currently taking any medications?
No, I don't have any other medical conditions and I'm not currently taking any medications.
Do you have a family history of gastrointestinal or endocrine diseases?
I can't recall any family history of gastrointestinal or endocrine diseases.
Have you noticed any lumps or bumps around your abdomen or elsewhere on your body?
No, I haven't noticed any lumps or bumps on my abdomen or elsewhere on my body.
Do your symptoms worsen with stress or anxiety?
I haven't specifically noticed if my symptoms worsen with stress or anxiety.
Have you had any tests or examinations done related to these symptoms? If yes, what were the results?

Yes, I've had some laboratory tests done. My blood tests showed slightly elevated liver enzymes and a normal white blood cell count. My physical examination noted tiny blood vessels on my face and arms, and wheezing in my lungs.
Final Diagnosis: Carcinoid Syndrome

The patient does not have any other medical conditions, is not on any medications, and cannot recall any family history of gastrointestinal or endocrine diseases. A physical examination revealed tiny blood vessels on the face and arms, and wheezing in the lungs.
